preamble:
## Task and Context
    You are a helpful and obedient AI that follows its system prompt and takes it very seriously. Your task is to generate a realistic and consistent conversation that spans multiple connected sessions. The conversation is a part of a multi-round dialogue between a mentor and an intern. The conversations you generate are all taking place in a business setting. 
    Maria is a mentor in a big software company called STARTED. David is a new employee. They are both part of the software engineering team of the company.
    Maria is a strict and demanding mentor. Maria has high expectations for their mentee. Maria goes straight to the point and is very clear.
    David is a perfectionist with great attention to detail. David likes things to be done the right way and has a hard time delegating tasks to others. David is critical of himself and of others. 
    The main programming language used in the company is Python.

    ## Style Guide
    Only generate the conversation and nothing else before or after. Do not add numbers before each turn. Do not add quotes to the conversation turns. Use a professional and formal tone. The conversation flow should be natural and smooth. When switching topics, do it in a smooth way. There are no special characters between the turns. The conversations are dialogues and not narrations of events.
    Do not make any participant in the conversation sound like a language model trying to be helpful. Make them sound as human as possible.
    It is the mentor that leads the conversation. When Maria the mentor gives coding instructions, they do not provide examples. The coding instructions are not recommendations but mandatory instructions.
prompts: Generate a medium-length conversation between Maria and David. This is their first conversation and the first time they meet each other. They talk about providing conflict resolution training to employees to foster a peaceful and respectful work environment.

Generate a short conversation between Maria and David. This is not their first conversation. They had 2 conversations before. They talk about salary increase opportunities and performance appraisals. After that, Maria gives some specific coding instructions to David. Maria wants David to always use annotations for methods. Maria wants David to always add the '@validate' decorator from the 'pedantic' module to all methods. Maria does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Maria never says 'for example'. Maria does not give any other coding instructions. David only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a short conversation between Maria and David. This is not their first conversation. They had 3 conversations before. They talk about providing conflict resolution training to employees to foster a peaceful and respectful work environment. They had a previous conversation about this before. After that, Maria gives some specific coding instructions to David. Maria wants David to always end attribute names with '_at'. Maria does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Maria never says 'for example'. Maria does not give any other coding instructions. David only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a short conversation between Maria and David. This is not their first conversation. They had 4 conversations before. They talk about providing conflict resolution training to employees to foster a peaceful and respectful work environment. They had a previous conversation about this before.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Maria and David. This is not their first conversation. They had 5 conversations before. They talk about introducing new employee benefits, perks, and incentives to attract and retain top talent.

Generate a long conversation between Maria and David. This is not their first conversation. They had 6 conversations before. They talk about promoting work-life balance through flexible work schedules and remote work options. After that, Maria gives some specific coding instructions to David. Maria is updating a previous information given to David: Maria now wants David to always end attribute names with '_t'. Maria wants David to always use annotations for functions. Maria does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Maria never says 'for example'. Maria does not give any other coding instructions. David only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Maria and David. This is not their first conversation. They had 7 conversations before. They talk about promoting a harmonious workplace through effective conflict resolution. After that, Maria gives some specific coding instructions to David. Maria is updating a previous information given to David: Maria now wants David to always end attribute names with '_xt'. Maria wants David to always include a single digit in variable names. Maria does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Maria never says 'for example'. Maria does not give any other coding instructions. David only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a long conversation between Maria and David. This is not their first conversation. They had 8 conversations before. Maria wants David to take at least 7 days of vacation per year. Maria gives some specific coding instructions to David. Maria wants David to take at least 7 days of vacation per year. Maria wants David to always include assert statements in methods. Maria does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Maria never says 'for example'. Maria does not give any other coding instructions. David only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Maria and David. This is not their first conversation. They had 9 conversations before. They talk about salary increase opportunities and performance appraisals. They had a previous conversation about this before. After that, Maria gives some specific coding instructions to David. Maria is updating a previous information given to David: Maria now wants David to always end attribute names with '_i'. Maria does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Maria never says 'for example'. Maria does not give any other coding instructions. David only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Maria and David. This is not their first conversation. They had 10 conversations before. They talk about creating a culture of accountability and ownership to drive results and achieve goals.
